data.title: Dynamic key bindings
data.body:
Started working on the usage of dynamic key bindings #271.

At the moment, it is only a preparsed (no trailing/leading space) String to Event parser and a dynamic modification of the event/action mapping.

data.title: "Fontconfig could not provide font DejaVu Serif Book"
data.body:
Hello there. I am trying to run openage on OSX 10.11.3. After following the building instructions, I ran into this error. I verified that I do have the DejaVu Serif font book installed.

```
➜  openage git:(master) make run
[  1%] Built target compilepy
[  2%] Built target cythonize
[  2%] Built target codegen
[ 84%] Built target libopenage
[ 86%] Built target openage_cppinterface_setup_checker
[ 87%] Built target openage_convert_slp
[ 88%] Built target openage_testing_misc_cpp
[ 89%] Built target openage_cabextract_lzxd
[ 90%] Built target openage_cabextract_cabchecksum
[ 91%] Built target openage_game_main_cpp
[ 92%] Built target openage_log_log_cpp
[ 93%] Built target openage_util_fslike_cpp
[ 94%] Built target openage_testing_cpp_testing
[ 96%] Built target run
[ 97%] Built target openage_cppinterface_exctranslate
[ 98%] Built target openage_cppinterface_exctranslate_tests
[ 99%] Built target openage_cppinterface_pyobject
[100%] Built target inplacemodules
[100%] Built target pxdgen
[100%] Built target distfiles
./run game
INFO [T11810063464666370627] launching engine with data directory './assets'
INFO [T11810063464666370627] SDL audio subsystems initialized
2016-03-12 12:07:57.358 run[38931:432742] 12:07:57.358 WARNING:  140: This application, or a library it uses, is using the deprecated Carbon Component Manager for hosting Audio Units. Support for this will be removed in a future release. Also, this makes the host incompatible with version 3 audio units. Please transition to the API's in AudioComponent.h.
INFO [T11810063464666370627] Using audio device: default [freq=48000, format=32784, channels=, samples=4096]
Fontconfig error: Cannot load default config file
INFO [T11810063464666370627] Font queried: DejaVu Serif:style=Book
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run.py", line 15, in init run (/Users/solo/Projects/openage/run.cpp:832)
    main()
  File "/Users/solo/Projects/openage/openage/__main__.py", line 94, in main
    return args.entrypoint(args, cli.error)
  File "/Users/solo/Projects/openage/openage/game/main.py", line 39, in main
    return run_game(args, assets)
  File "openage/game/main_cpp.pyx", line 20, in openage.game.main_cpp.run_game (/Users/solo/Projects/openage/openage/game/main_cpp.cpp:858)
    result = run_game_cpp(args_cpp)
  File "", line 0, in __pyx_pw_7openage_4game_8main_cpp_1run_game(_object*, _object*, _object*)+0x3d0
  File "", line 0, in openage::run_game(openage::main_arguments const&)+0x15a
  File "", line 0, in openage::Engine::create(openage::util::Dir*, char const*)+0xfd
  File "", line 0, in openage::Engine::Engine(openage::util::Dir*, char const*)+0x433
  File "", line 0, in openage::renderer::FontManager::get_font(char const*, char const*, unsigned int)+0x1a
  File "", line 0, in openage::renderer::FontManager::get_font_filename(char const*, char const*)+0x35f
  File "", line 0, in openage::error::Error::Error(openage::log::message const&, bool, bool)+0xf8
  File "", line 0, in openage::error::StackAnalyzer::analyze()+0xd7
  File "libopenage/renderer/font/font_manager.cpp", line 32, in static std::string openage::renderer::FontManager::get_font_filename(const char *, const char *)
    throw Error(MSG(err) << "Fontconfig could not provide font " << family << " " << style);
openage.cppinterface.exctranslate.CPPException: Fontconfig could not provide font DejaVu Serif Book
make: *** [run] Error 1
```

Any ideas?

data.title: Asset conversion failure Age of Kings
data.body:
```
liam@liamacer ~/Software/openage (git)-[master] % ./run                                                                                                              
INFO [py] No converted assets have been found
media conversion is required.
please provide your AoE II installation dir:
> /home/liam/Games/aoe2
WARN [py] None supported of the Game version(s) Age of Empires 2: The Age of Kings
 ERR [py] game asset conversion failed
liam@liamacer ~/Software/openage (git)-[master] %

```

I have both empires2.exe and data/empires2.dat in the instillation directory however the data folder is in upper case. Even when changing it to lower it still fails.

Is there anything else I can do to debug this issue? The game is an old cd version not a steam one.

data.body:
Additional to our job subsystem, it might come in handy to use libuv:

http://libuv.org/

We can use it primarily for network transmissions, for filesystem access our job system is good enough already I hope.

Fixes #369.

data.title: Update gamedata-struct.md from implementation
data.body:
https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/master/doc/media/gamedata-struct.md

is out of date as the actual implementation was updated (mainly by me) but not the docs.
- [X] Please **synchronize the struct** from the code at https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/tree/master/openage/convert/gamedata to the documentation at gamedata-struct.md
- [ ] The implementation is straightforward and pretty much declares the complete format.
  In theory, we can even generate the documentation from that to avoid redundancy (probably best solution). All further update effort will be 0 if you **create a python script** that reads the gamedata definition from the above implementation and saves to a markdown file with a pseudo-c-struct.

data.title: fixes documentation issue #511
data.body:
If a parent directory of openage contains a space, 'make doc' (or better, doxygen)
splits the absolute path from the INPUT tag in bin/Doxygen in two directorys.
That way, the necessary files cannot be found and no documentation is created.

This commit adds quotation marks to the responsible cmake file.

```
geändert:               buildsystem/doxygen.cmake
```

data.title: 'make doc' fails, if a parent directory has a white space
data.body:
'make doc' didn't create the documentation, only a sceleton index.html. This was repeatedly written on the shell:
`Warning: tag INPUT: input source '/home/castilma/somedir/otherdir' does not exist`
`Warning: tag INPUT: input source 'withwhitespace/openage/libopenage/' does not exist"`

Where 'otherdir withwhitespace' has a space in it's name.

As a workaround I renamed the 'otherdir withwhitespace' removing the space and rerun ./configure  and 'make doc'. 

I have no experience with cmake, but I imagine there's just somewhere one line like 
.... $OPENAGE_DIR ... 
which should be
... "$OPENAGE_DIR" ...
.

data.title: [WIP] Changes to cmake to generate Visual Studio 2015 solution and project files
data.body:
Some changes were needed in the way Python was detected. 

py_get_config_var(LIBDIR PYTHON_LIBRARY_DIR) did not get the python lib directory correctly on Windows, so the lib directory is created after reading the python config var ''BINDIR". 

Changes for windows paths using '\' which are converted into posix paths before any comparison.

data.title: Visual Studio 2015 build
data.body:
Hi,

Continuing the discussion from IRC, making a note here. I have been trying to generate the build solution using cmake here: https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/compare/master...synth2014:master

I was able to generate the solution file. It would be great if some else could give it a try too. 

There were a number of projects generated in the VS solution: http://s12.postimg.org/4tz4oiivh/projects.png

I am now trying to get rid of the 800+ errors that I get with VS 2015 community edition in libopenage: http://pastebin.com/sn5bXv4V

The changes work in Linux and the makefile, and the build completes successfully.

data.title: Clang 3.5 can't compile openage
data.body:
I've tried to compile openage using clang 3.5 on Fedora 22 and I've got following error when compiling libopenage/game_save.cpp:

error: debug information for auto is not yet supported

It's most probably bug in clang, the solution can be to bump up the required version of clang to 3.6, where this bug is fixed.

data.title: GUI ingame background assets adaptation (AOC/HD)
data.body:
There are 1280x1024 backgrounds currently extractable from the AOC game data (if interface.dat is enabled in the conversion script). No subtextures defined.
1. For the ingame HUD: I'm going to manually specify the coordinates of the bottom rectangles that are in the corners.
2. For the top stripe of the ingame HUDs it's possible to detect a repeating pattern and get coordinates of a good piece. I've ported a `visgrep` utility from xautomation to python. It does the pattern search without having something like OpenCV or GIMP as a dependency.

Middle-bottom part of the HUD - that should be probably generated at runtime because the aspect ratio is dynamic. So, it's not a part of this PR.

For the first push there is only the `visgrep.py` utility.

If someone can confirm that we can't extract more metadata from the game resources, I'll hardcode the points 1 and 2. Especially useful info would be the list of filenames that correspond to these 1280x1024 backgrounds, otherwise that will have to be hardcoded too.

data.title: Track configuration changes
data.body:
All configuration changes, e.g. mod updates, keybindings, graphics settings, etcetc should be logged. That way, a user can determine what caused some break.

Actually all software in the world should do it this way.

data.title: assets/CMakeLists.txt ends up in install prefix
data.body:
It gets installed to `$PREFIX/share/openage/CMakeLists.txt`
Probably needs to be excluded because the whole `assets` directory is marked for installation.

data.title: Use precompiled headers
data.body:
To speed up things especially with templates, gcc supports header precompiling.

https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Precompiled-Headers.html

Please integrate this into our buildsystem! Header files would have to be registered like `.cpp` files then.

data.title: Buildsystem improvements, once again
data.body:
- Mainly fixes the devmode installation.
- Python files are now compiled by a python script and not by `compileall`
- the `configure` script is now pylint compliant
- We no longer need a c compiler (I hope it's not just because of my cmake `>=3.4.0`)
  - ok, i was wrong. but i "fixed" it by reusing cxx as the c compiler if cmake is `<3.4.0`
- Compiler flags are no longer duplicated
- 2 random warning fixes for move-optimization and atomic_flag initialization

data.title: Release CXX flags
data.body:
There are some unexplained lines in `buildsystem/HandleCXXOptions.cmake`:

```
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -g")
set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELEASE "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS}")
```

Why someone isn't happy with CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG and CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_RELEASE that CMake provides (in gcc, for example, it's "-g" and "-O3 -DNDEBUG")?

(putting aside the fact that CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS_DEBUG is concatenated to the CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS by CMake automatically, so there is no need to append CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS second time)

Question arose because there is no "-DNDEBUG" in Release currently, and I want it back.
